author: pipermerriam
content: We use era1 files as a data source for seeding data into the network (primarily for old data like 4444s)

author: pipermerriam
content: And we use JSON-RPC from a running execution client for seeding data from the HEAD of the chain.

author: kevaundray
content:
Oh I see, so pre 4444 you can seed the network with era1 files and post 4444 you can periodically seed the network (making sure to only seed blocks which you know won’t be re-orged)

I guess since post merge you won’t be able to query blocks by block number, a re-org where you’ve somehow stored the re-orged block in portal won’t actually be detrimental

author: pipermerriam
content: Dealing with re-orgs is somewhat low priority for 4444s use case.  The geeneral plan is that any HEAD blocks that get re-org'd would get swept out of the network once they transition past the epoch boundary.   At this point, their accumulator proof that shows the block is canonical gets frozen and any re-org blocks would get evicted from any nodes that happen to have stored them...
